Abstract: The intricate relationships between diet and disease have long been a subject of research, with emerging evidence suggesting that personalized nutrition approaches can significantly impact disease prevention and management. This study explores the application of artificial intelligence (AI) in deciphering diet-disease relationships, with a focus on precision nutrition. Through a series of case studies, we demonstrate the potential of neural networks to analyze large-scale dietary data and identify high-risk patterns associated with various diseases. Our results show that AI-driven approaches can accurately predict disease susceptibility based on individual nutritional profiles, enabling the development of personalized dietary interventions. These findings have significant implications for the field of nutrition, highlighting the potential of AI to revolutionize the way we approach diet-disease relationships and promote precision nutrition. Future research directions are discussed, emphasizing the need for further investigation into the efficacy and scalability of AI-driven precision nutrition approaches.
